subject: This Week on Reliable Sources
body:
CNN.com










Coming up this Sunday on Reliable Sources: 

Paris Deja Vu

For those who thought the
media mania over Paris Hilton was on a three week hiatus while
she served a jail sentence were sorely disappointed this week
when the celebutante was released from jail early, only to be
sent right back.  The ensuing media mayhem hit epic
proportions.	Why did the media place such importance on this
that a shakeup at the pentagon got just a quarter of an hour's
coverage so the networks could race back to the Paris stakeout?
Will we ever hear the last of the heiress?

Scooter
Libby Double Standard?

While Paris Hilton's jail
time got practically non-stop coverage, the sentencing of
Scooter Libby seemed to barely get any media notice.  But while
the media dished about Paris representing a double standard,
what about the pundits who were so hot on "rule of law" during
Clinton's purjury testimony that are now calling for Libby to
be pardoned?

Rating the Debates

We'll
look at this week's big debates in New Hampshire and talk about
why the nightly newscasts seem not to be paying much attention
to them at this stage in the game.  We'll look at how the the
spin cycle launches into action to declare the winners and
losers nearly as soon as the last question is asked.

Plus,  One columnist is suggesting we're seeing a
little bit too much of the candidates' wives these days, We'll
talk about coverage of cleavage on the campaign trail.

Join us this Sunday and every Sunday at 10am ET / 7am PT
for our critical look at the media!
